clinical_study.brief_title: Fear of Falling in Patients With Chronic Stroke
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of a Community Rehabilitation Programme for Enhancing Subjective Balance Confidence in Patients With Chronic Stroke: A Randomized, Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to evaluate whether combining cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) with task-oriented balance training (TOBT) is more effective than general health education (GHE) together with TOBT in promoting fear of falling and reducing activity avoidance behavior.

detailed_description.textblock: The null hypothesis of this study will be that no significant difference in the efficacy of the two treatments (CBT + TOBT; GHE + TOBT) in promoting fear of falling and reducing fear avoidance behavior, and thus no significant difference in improving balance ability, reducing fall risks, improving health-related quality of life and community reintegration of people with stroke.

primary_outcome.description: The Activities-specific Balance Confidence (ABC) scale --- Chinese version will be used to assess the level of fear of falling.

secondary_outcome.description: The Survey of Activities and Fear of Falling in the Elderly - Chinese version will be used to assess the level of fear avoidance behavior.
The Berg Balance Scale will be used to assess the clinical balance performance.
The Short-form Physiological Profile Assessment will be used to assess the fall risk.
The Lawton Instrumental Activities of Daily Living scale will be used to assess the ability of participants to live independently in the community.
The Community Integration Measure - Chinese version will be used to assess the level of community integration.
The Short Form (SF-36) General Health Questionnaire - Chinese version will be used to measure the health-related quality of life.

arm_group.description: Subjects will receive general health education and task-oriented balance training.
Subjects will receive group-based cognitive behavioral therapy and task-oriented balance training.

intervention.description: All subjects will receive 45 minutes of GHE, followed by 45 minutes of TOBT program twice a week for 8 weeks.
All subjects will receive 45 minutes of CBT, followed by 45 minutes of TOBT program twice a week for 8 weeks.
